result.execSummary:
The defendant Ladell O Bogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Ladell O Bogan in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Ladell O Bogan.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Cts 2 & 3- GUILTY. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: Cts 2 & 3 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 90 days RCJ, Huber for work and or treatment on each count to run concurrent. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, payment plan $50/month beginning 11/1/2022.

9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ladell O Bogan in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Ladell O Bogan. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Preliminary hearing waived, probable cause found, bound over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ladell O Bogan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Ladell O Bogan. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Return on warrant/Initial appearance on August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
Warrant is being forwarded to RCSO/Dispatch for entry
